content: diamond pouch by veruska beginner level notions crochet hook cotton yarn stitch marker zipper with a bottom stop tapestry needle sewing needle thread of the same colour of the zipper and basting thread in contrasting colour yarn sesia cotton cablé number 3 1 ball hook 3 c hook gauge 26 sts and 24 row= 10 cm 4 inches in pattern stitch special stitches crab stitch at the end of the row *working backwards pull the hook inside the previous stitch yarn over draw up a loop yarn over both loops on hook* instructions measure the zipper length from top stop to bottom stop it must be 10 centimetres 4 inches long see picture 1 picture1 crochet the pouch chain 23 nd round 1 always work in one loop of the chain stitch only single_crochet 3 in 2 chain from hook single_crochet in each chain stitch single_crochet 2 in first chain stitch turn chain and work 1sc in each chain st on the other side of the chain 47sts do not join round place marker in the first stitch of second round round 2-13 work *1sc 1 double_crochet* all around if crocheted correctly from round 3 on you should work a single_crochet into the double_crochet below and a double_crochet into the single_crochet below note working the corners can be difficult to make it easier turn them inside out and work the corner stitches work pattern evenly in a spiral moving the marker in the first stitch of every new row you will have a flat rectangular pouch round 14 look at picture 2 find the half of each side of the rectangular pouch points c and d pinch points c and d and pull outwards look at the green arrows in picture 2 if the two sides are too short to meet continue working in spiral until the sides meet picture 3 then move marker to c or d and work in pattern until you reach it end the round with a single_crochet if necessary working one stitch further than c note c or d is now the new first stitch of round round 15 work one last round in crab stitch remove marker break yarn weave in ends with the tapestry needle if you prefer you can work single_crochet only rounds instead of the pattern sewing the zipper open up the zipper open the pouch as in picture 3 fold the tape over the top stops and hide it between the zipper and the pouch while basting the zipper to the pouch see pictures 4 and 5 picture4 picture5 baste the zipper to the pouch starting by basting the top stop against c or d leave about 0 2 cm 0 1 inch between the pouch and the teeth otherwise you couldn t be able to close the zipper easily if necessary use pins to keep the zipper in place while you baste it picture6 it is easier to baste the first half of the zipper from top to bottom
